channel.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
channel.description:
I found hard mode to be still too easy. I blazed through the original on hard mode. Find some way to make it harder, like disable the quick save option cause that is like cheating. You could save every second if you wanted to, know what I mean? :slight_smile:
I waited 6 years for this game to be released and I don't wanna spend a quick time finishing it, I want to enjoy it thoroughly, thanks. :smiley:
Suggestions:
- Randomize the location of enemies and supplies for every loading. - Allow enemies to break/open doors so you can't hide so much. - Disable quicksave - Add insane difficulty - Use SWAT 4 weapon mechanics where each reload is a whole new clip. (Ex. when you reload a gun with 20/30 ammo, the old clip remains for the next time, so you will have 20 bullets in one of your available clips, making the player choose wisely when to reload) - Allow the enemy AI to take notice of player sounds (running, firing, breaking crates).
That's all I have right now, lol. :stuck_out_tongue:

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
eateroftheflame:

Doesn’t sound very jokey, or maybe that’s part of it, I hate message board humour :retard:

Oh, you were talking about the feg, haha. I thought you were adding to Maxey and Angdraugs comments.

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
k3nny1550:

I’m pretty sure they do that in Shadow of Chernobyl.

But this is Black Mesa. So no.

Half-Life in the X-ray engine :awesome: .

I also hate games where reloading causes you to lose ammo. Especially if the game doesn’t tell you beforehand.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: eateroftheflame
item.description:
Source:

Oh, don’t get me started… just put 10 times MORE AntLions in the game…hell, put them everywhere… those annoying bastards… I hate them with a passion… ugly as sin, and twice as annoying… aaaaaagggghhh! OK, I’m fine, no problem, just take deep breaths… stupid AntLions…

Doesn’t sound very jokey, or maybe that’s part of it, I hate message board humour :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: BrAndi
item.description:
I hereby once again submit my request for realistic colt reloading !

  1. Gordon tilts out the drum.
  2. He covers the full chambers, e.g. the amount of chambers not depleted with his palm or thumb.
  3. He empties the bullet casings that were left uncovered by using gravitational force.
  4. He closes the drum.

(Pure .357 sexsthetics)

Read full topic
item.source: Suggestions to make the game more challenging

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
JamesKane:

The engine has a max entity limit which is different than hammer’s recommended max limit.

Bah, I knew I was going to to be corrected somehow when my answer seemed needlessly complex. :retard:

Read full topic
item.source: Suggestions to make the game more challenging

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
JamesKane:

The engine has a max entity limit which is different than hammer’s recommended max limit.
The one in hammer is designed to limit mappers so they wont exceed valve’s recommended budget…obviously BM is more demanding.

Isn’t the Hammer limit something like twice the built-in Engine limit?

EDIT: Never mind, the limit is for VBSP.

Read full topic
item.source: Suggestions to make the game more challenging

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: dagrox94
item.description:
1. Realistic reloading - reloading your weapon while still having ammo in the clip results in losing the ammo or having a half-full clip in your inventory for later reload.

Hated it when Alien Swarm did it. Realism isn’t always ‘fun’, thus the invention of videogames themselves.

Read full topic

item.description:
Put the game on Onlive. Nobody will be able to play it because of the shitty lag.

And @Dias, I think that makes sense. But would that mean if a player were to run through the entire level on godmode and not kill a single enemy the game would crash?

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I assume it’s because having npcs active at the same time would cause errors, but since many locations are closed off from one another, triggers are used to spawn npcs in areas the player can get to & remove npcs the player can’t back-track to.

or something to that effect. :3

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
Raminator wrote:

The vast majority of our maps are exceeding the maximum allowable entity data by more than 100%; if we start getting any more complex setups, you’re going to run into issues during gameplay.

I’m confused: If you exceed maximum allowable entity data, how come the game actually can be played? Isn’t maximum a limit?

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I always play games on either the normal or hard difficulty. I used to conserve items and ammo like crazy, on the grounds of ‘you never know’, but I’ve learned that’s almost entirely self-imposed baloney.

Have you considered the possibility that you just suck?

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions to make the game more challenging
item.dc:creator: Skaevola
item.description:
Try playing a game on a mode harder than Easy sometime, you’ll see a lot of games include ammo conservation

Alan Wake on Nightmare has the most intense ammo conservation ever. Running completely out of ammo on the first boss? Bad mojo.
